page.title: 14THE RIVER DOUR AND ITS MILLS
page.content: FOR MANY YEARS DOVER HAS BEEN AN IMPORTANT CENTRE FOR PAPER MAKING.THE MILLS ARE SITUATED ON THE BANKS OF THE DOUR WHICH RUNS FROM WATERSEND TO WELLINGTON DOCK.OF THE ORIGINAL 6 MILLS,ONLY 2 REMAIN VIZ:THE BUCKLAND & CRABBLE MILLS COLLECTIVELY KNOWN AS BUCKLAND PAPER MILL.THEY WERE BUILT ALONGSIDE THE RIVER SO AS TO PROVIDE A GOOD SUPPLY OF WATER,ESSENTIAL FOR PAPER MAKING. THE MILL AT BUCKLAND PRODUCES BUISNESS STATIONERY UNDER THE NAME "CONQUEROR",MINISTRY OF DEFENCE PAPER, ADMIRALTY CHART PAPER,DECORATIVE LAMINATES AND SPECIAL PAPERS.30o/o OF THE PAPER IS EXPORTED. THE MILL AT CRABBLE SERVES AS A PACKING AND ASSEMBLY POINT FOR EXPORT ORDERS AS WELL AS PACKING PAPERS FOR USE IN THIS COUNTRY.
